meanings.definition: Having a hunched or bent back.
meanings.sent1: The old cat was crookbacked and moved slowly.
meanings.sent2: The crookbacked tree provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The crookbacked scarecrow in the field made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: The crookbacked road twisted and turned through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The crookbacked bridge creaked under the weight of the travelers.

meanings.definition: A person with a hunched or bent back.
meanings.sent1: The crookbacked man walked with a cane for support.
meanings.sent2: The crookbacked woman told stories by the fire.
meanings.sent3: The crookbacked farmer grew the tallest sunflowers in town.
meanings.sent4: The crookbacked figure in the painting seemed to watch over the room.
meanings.sent5: The crookbacked beggar sang songs of hope on the street corner.
